intro: Erigeron hispidus, commonly known as the hairy fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils. Its leaves are hairy and grayish-green, while the flowers are white to pale blue, often with a yellow center. It is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions and is often used in native plant gardens.
